title: 114_hr5347
content: The Act titled "Social Security Disability Fairness Act of 2016" allows for phased-in payment of SSDI benefits for terminally ill individuals during the waiting period. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for disability insurance benefits for individuals determined to be under a disability. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for disability insurance benefits for individuals determined to be under a disability. The amendment includes changes to subparagraphs and paragraphs related to the entitlement of disability insurance benefits for individuals meeting specific criteria. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions for disability insurance benefits for individuals determined to be under a disability. The entitlement to disability insurance benefits is based on the individual's disability status and the duration of consecutive calendar months they have been entitled to such benefits. The benefit amount is determined based on specific percentages for each consecutive calendar month, with adjustments for subsequent periods of 12 consecutive calendar months. The disability insurance benefit amount is calculated based on the individual's entitlement to benefits for consecutive calendar months. If entitled for 24 consecutive months, the benefit amount is reduced to 95 percent of the original amount determined. In subsection (d)(2), an individual can be determined to be under a disability upon submission of a terminal illness diagnosis certified by 2 physicians. The Commissioner of Social Security must report annually to Congress. The Commissioner of Social Security, in coordination with the Inspector General, will submit a report to Congress evaluating disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, including the number who apply, receive benefits, and pass away within specific time frames. The report to Congress will evaluate disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals, including the number who receive benefits and recommendations to prevent fraud and abuse. The Comptroller General of the United States will submit a report to Congress evaluating disability insurance benefits for terminally ill individuals and providing recommendations for legislation and administrative actions to improve benefits. The amendments made by this section will apply to benefits payable after December 31, 2016, and will cease to have effect on January 1, 2022. The amendments to section 223 of the Social Security Act will cease to have effect on January 1, 2022.
